channel.title: HTML on Sujith's Library
channel.description: Recent content in HTML on Sujith's Library

item.title: Boiler Plate
item.description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) defines the structure and content of webpages. We use HTML elements to create all the paragraphs, headings, lists, images, and links that make up a typical webpage.

item.title: Texts & Lists
item.description:
Paragraphs <p> </p>

All text can be placed inside the <body>, but spaces will not be considered without using paragraph tags. The <p> tag can be used to create distinct paragraphs.

item.title: Links & Images
item.description:
Anchor Elements

An anchor element is defined by wrapping the text or another HTML element we want to link with an <a> tag.

item.title: Input Types
item.description: The <input> HTML element is used to create interactive controls for web-based forms to accept data from users. It provides a wide variety of input types and control widgets depending on the device and user agent. The <input> element is one of the most powerful and complex in HTML due to the numerous combinations of input types and attributes available.

item.title: Button
item.description:
<button></button>

The <button> element represents a clickable button that can be used to submit forms or trigger actions on the webpage. It can contain text, images, or other HTML elements.

item.title: DOM Events
item.description:
HTML DOM Events

HTML events are actions that occur to HTML elements, which JavaScript can respond to. By using event listeners, you can execute JavaScript code in reaction to these events.
